flawed_nl_solution:
Start by finding how many fish were in the aquarium on the third day 6 * 2 * 2 = <<6*2*2=24>>24.
On day three, Jason took out one-third of the fish 24 / 3 = <<24/3=8>>8.
So at the end of day three, he has 24 - 8 = <<24-8=18>>18 fish.
On day five he has 18 * 2 * 2 = 72 fish, but he takes out one-fourth.
So he took out 72 / 4 = <<72/4=18>>18 fishes.
So at the end of day five, he has 72 - 18 = <<72-18=54>>54 fish.
On day seven he has 54 * 2 * 2 = <<54*2*2=216>>216 fish.
He adds in 15 more, so he has 216 + 15 = <<216+15=231>>231 fish in total.
#### 231

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 16, not 18. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
